thread.title: 2018 World Cup Group D qualifier: Indian team’s arrival delayed
thread.title_full: 2018 World Cup Group D qualifier: Indian team’s arrival delayed

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: 2018 World Cup Group D qualifier: Indian team’s arrival delayed
text:
2018 World Cup Group D qualifier: Indian team’s arrival delayed Muscat Daily staff writer October 11, 2015 
The arrival of the Indian football team, which was scheduled to reach Muscat on Friday night for Tuesday's 2018 World Cup Group D qualifier against Oman, was delayed by a day. 
The team arrived in Muscat late on Saturday night as the delegation was stranded in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan over a flight delay, according to sources in the Oman Football Association (OFA). 
India lost at Turkmenistan 1-2 on Thursday and was to fly to Muscat en route Dubai, UAE. 
However, bad weather in Turkmenistan led to the cancellation of several flights, forcing the Indian team to be stranded at the airport in Ashgabat. 
The delay meant the Indians lost a day's practice and would have relatively less time to recover and prepare for the Oman game. 
Tuesday's match, which will be played at the Sultan Qaboos Sports Complex, kicks off at 6.30pm. 
India coach Stephen Constantine wrote on the All India Football Federation's (AIFF) official Twitter handle, "The sudden change of events has come as a huge disadvantage. We had an agreement with the OFA about our practice sessions [in Oman], but we are helpless at the moment." 
"Every training session is important and we cannot afford to miss any. I am also worried about the recovery of the players," he added. Similar content
